name: Olive
description: Athena's sacred gift to Athens, the olive tree represents wisdom, peace, prosperity, and victory. Olympic victors crowned with olive wreaths. Sacred olive groves at Athens and Olympia provided oil for lamps, anointing, and prizes.

mythologicalOrigin.contest: Athena vs Poseidon competed for Athens' patronage
mythologicalOrigin.poseidonsGift: Poseidon struck rock, salt water spring emerged
mythologicalOrigin.athenasGift: Athena planted first olive tree on Acropolis
mythologicalOrigin.judgment: Athenians chose olive as more valuable - food, oil, wood, peace
mythologicalOrigin.result: Athens named for Athena, olive became sacred symbol
mythologicalOrigin.originalTree: Sacred olive on Acropolis burned by Persians, miraculously sprouted new shoot next day

uses: Olympic crowns - wreaths from sacred Athena's grove crowned Olympic victors
Panathenaic prizes - winners received amphorae filled with sacred olive oil
Temple lamps - olive oil fueled eternal flames in temples
Sacred anointing - athletes, brides, priests anointed with olive oil
Peace symbol - olive branches extended for truce and diplomacy
Purification - olive oil in cleansing rituals
Funeral rites - olive branches honored the dead
rituals: Olympic Games - victors crowned with kotinos (olive wreath) from Zeus's sacred grove at Olympia
Panathenaic Festival - olive oil from sacred trees awarded to athletic and artistic winners
Peace offerings - defeated armies presented olive branches for mercy
Marriage ceremonies - brides wore olive wreaths for Athena's blessing
Sanctuary consecration - olive oil anointed temples and altars
Harvest festival - thanksgiving for olive crop with offerings to Athena

sacredOliveGroves.acropolis: Original olive planted by Athena, sacred to Athens
sacredOliveGroves.olympia: Zeus's sacred grove provided Olympic wreaths
sacredOliveGroves.academy: Plato's Academy surrounded by sacred olives
sacredOliveGroves.athenasSanctuary: Olive groves around temples protected by law - death penalty for cutting sacred tree

sacredSignificance: Athena's supreme gift, more valuable than Poseidon's might. Olive = civilization, culture, peace over war. Olympic victors' crown worth more than gold. Sacred olive trees legally protected - harming one = capital crime. Symbol of Athens, wisdom, and Greek identity itself.
culturalContext: Mediterranean civilization built on olive cultivation. 'Liquid gold' - olive oil wealth of ancient Greece. Trade, cooking, lighting, medicine, cosmetics, anointing. Olive branch still universal peace symbol. Athena's tree endures 3000+ years.
preparationMethods: Sacred oil: cold-press first harvest olives from sacred groves
Wreaths: weave fresh olive branches with leaves
Anointing: pure olive oil for blessing and consecration
Offerings: pour libations of finest olive oil
Culinary: table olives cured in brine or salt
Medicinal: olive leaf tea for blood pressure and immunity

growingConditions.climate: Mediterranean - hot dry summers, mild wet winters
growingConditions.fruiting: Begins producing 5-8 years, full production 20 years

symbolicMeanings: Evergreen leaves = immortality and eternal life
Fruit and oil = abundance and prosperity
Silver-green leaves = wisdom and Athena's grey eyes

healthBenefits.oil: Monounsaturated fats, oleic acid, antioxidants, anti-inflammatory
healthBenefits.fruit: Vitamin E, iron, copper, healthy fats
healthBenefits.mediterraneanDiet: Cornerstone of world's healthiest traditional diet

safetyWarnings: generally very safe - staple food for millennia
olive leaf extract may lower blood pressure - monitor if on medications
consume in moderation - high calorie content
